alert.note: Alert for DeKalb; Fulton (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 09 at 9:36AM EST until January 09 at 9:13PM EST by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Peachtree City GA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Georgia... North Fork Peachtree Creek at Buford Hwy Atlanta affecting DeKalb and Fulton Counties. For the Peachtree Creek...including Buford Hwy Atlanta...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...North Fork Peachtree Creek at Buford Hwy Atlanta. * WHEN...Until late this evening. * IMPACTS...At 14.0 feet, Minor flooding continues along the creek upstream and downstream from the gage on Buford Highway or Georgia Highway 13. Portions of the backyards of residential homes on Victory Drive...Dunwoody Place and Converse Drive will be flooded with around one foot of water. This height combined with the flow on South Fork Peachtree Creek will likely produce flooding further downstream on Peachtree Creek in Fulton County. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:01 AM EST Tuesday the stage was 12.5 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage late this morning to 13.6 feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage late this afternoon to 10.1 feet and continue to fall below flood stage. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 13.5 feet on 05/03/2021. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta. The next statement will be issued this evening at 915 PM EST.
